title: [BUG]Obsolete member overrides non-obsolete member
body:
A bit of background to the above problem, I recently upgraded to Xamarin.AndroidX.AppCompat 1.2.0.7 and Xamarin.AndroidX.Navigation.Fragment 2.3.3.1 which immediately gave me deprecated warnings on ViewPager and FragmentStatePagerAdapter and FragmentPagerAdapter etc. I was using a ViewPager with FragmentStatePagerAdapter using two SKCanvas classes CircularGauge and SemiCircularGauge. The CircularGauge set up is reasonable complex because the user can choose to display either 2, 4 or 6 gauges on a page, so rather than directly modify the existing code I wrote a test app using ViewPager2 and the new FragmentStateAdapter to display 2 gauges per page for a total of 24 gauges, hence 12 pages or fragments.

I’ve been using the 2.80.2 version of SkiaSharp.Views for 3 or 4 months and haven’t had any issues before this. However now only on the CircularGauge, I get the message in the heading for OnSizeChanged and I’m struggling to figure out why.

Using the SemiCircularGauge class if I type
protected override – IntelliSense prompts you for all the overrides. But for the CircularGauge nothing. I feel as though I’m doing something really dumb but can’t figure it out.

Adding the pragma to eliminate the warning does get rid of the warning, but the method isn’t marked as an obsolete/deprecated member if the first place

Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Android 7.1 to 11.
